182272.name: Almanach der Zauberkunst
182272.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zauberei und Hexenkunst!

Seit die Menschen lernten, die Kräfte der Magie zu entfesseln, streben sie nach immer größerer Macht. Ob beim Studieren an magischen Universitäten, bei finsteren Riten in den Tiefen der Wälder oder bei Geisterbeschwörungen in den eleganten Salons, Magie ist mysteriös und doch überall.
Dieses Buch beinhaltet umfassende Hintergrundinformationen zur Magie im Finsterland, viele neue Spezialmanöver und Hintergründe, neue Gegner und ein vollständiges Abenteuer.


Translation Courtesy of Google:

Sorcery and witchcraft!

Since people learned to unleash the forces of magic, they strive for ever greater power. Whether while studying at magical universities in sinister rites in the depths of the forests or in exorcisms in the elegant salons, magic is mysterious and yet everywhere.
This book includes a comprehensive background information on the magic in Finster country, a lot of new special moves and backgrounds, new enemies and complete adventure.

182273.name: the GATE
182273.description:
In the GATE, a strategy game for two players, each player takes four faction cards and places the cards in front of them not shuffled, but separated by faction, face up in ascending order.

Once a player purchases a card from a faction's deck, that card becomes the source of various effects (mostly for attack action) and the topmost card of each faction's deck is the source of defense. Each turn, a player can do three kinds of actions with the cards in hand:


Enhance their factions.
Place guard cards (face down, one card for a faction).
Attack (to different spots).


If he succeeds with an attack, the opponent receives damage; if damage reaches a certain amount, that faction's "gate" perishes. When a player's two gates are demolished, the game ends and that player loses.

The core box of the GATE contains eight sets of factions, some of which are connected with worlds of other games, such as the DOME. More faction packs will be released after the core set.

182274.name: NXS
182274.description:
NXS (pronounced "nexus") is an abstract strategy game played on hexagonal boards with hexagonal pieces.

Each player has his or her own board. Each player sets up their pieces on their board in either a short game (7 piece) or long game (13-14 piece) configuration. Players push their boards together in either a two or three player arrangement. Players alternately move their pieces (and rotate them) in an attempt to capture both enemy pieces, and enemy territory. Enemy territory is captured by "surrounding" it.

Game play continues until one player captures a predetermined amount of enemy territory (usually 10 spaces).

Notes:
Although there are official short and long game setups, players can choose any agreed upon starting position of pieces that they like.

The amount of territory required to win can be adjusted for different types of play.

When playing advanced rules, a player may rotate his or her entire game board as a move.

Although it is officially a 2-3 player game, 6 players could surround a 7th neutral board and play a fully balanced game. Technically this makes it a two, three, or six player game.

182275.description: This is a promo miniature of the sheriff that was sold at Gen Con. It is meant to replace the card board standee of the sheriff.
182275.name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Sheriff Miniature

182276.description: Heroclix startup box from 2002 that is set in the Marvel universe. The game includes two double sided maps, ten non-random heroes, dice and tokens. The goal of the game is to defeat your enemies in combat using movement and positioning on urban maps and die rolls for combat.
182276.name: Marvel Heroclix: Infinity Challenge – Premiere Edition

182278.name: Incandescent
182278.description:
User Summary

Asteroids-style shoot 'em up that pits your ship against waves of enemies and every 10th wave you battle a boss as well. There are items dropped that give you powers and health. The whole game takes place in a large boxed screen and comes with a techno soundtrack.

182280.name: RPG Magazine (Issue 4 - Sep 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Cuidado com o que você Deseja

182284.name: Motto
182284.description:
What is your personal motto? Does it concern love, passion, or maybe money? Are you focused on finding the "other half" or fulfillment in a hobby — or do you just dream about fortune?

Everyone has their own life goals , but in Motto they are all equally important. Only a skillful combination will lead to the final victory. Iconic author Reiner Knizia brings you an attempt to connect these three values. Collect the right cards and combine them into strong melds to win the most valuable tokens. As in life, you will need a bit of luck, prediction, and cold calculation.

182285.name: The Hex Scouts Guide to Cryptozoology
182285.description:
From publisher blurb:

HERE THERE BE MONSTERS!

Did you know there are 4 types of Manticore?

Did you know Redcaps dyed their hats in the blood of their victims?

Did you know Gants are natives of the Realm of Mists?

The Hex Scout’s Guide to Cryptozoology is the definitive guide of magical and mythical beasts in the Drama Dice Multiverse!

From the Anansi to Zombies, learn the about the monsters that live not only in the magical mountains and forests, but those that live in the sewers and even in your closet.

Included are:

Dozens of Monsters
New and Expanded Skills
New Magic including Summoning and Totems
New Cliques expanding on the Rustic-Witch concept.
And much more.

182286.name: The Principia Permutationis
182286.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic is change.

The Principia Permutationis is the multiverse’s definitive guide to Alteration magic.

Containing transmutation history, concepts and theories it takes an often over looked magic and redefines it for a modern world with a little help from the Sorceress Supreme of Earth Nemesis, the sardonic and capricious Madame Raven.

Designed for use with all Drama Dice games, it can easily be adapted for other systems.

Includes:

New Witch Girl Cliques
New and expanded rules for Alchemy and Animate creation.
A Who’s Who of famous Transmuters
Alteration based monsters
Expanded Alteration spells and rules.

182287.name: The Raven's Call (5E)
182287.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Trollkin... And Drive Them Into the Sea!

The trollkin and their shaman have come to a village by the sea, stormed its walls, and taken all the villagers as slaves and property. They have eaten their way through the saltfish, devoured the herd of sheep, and might be planning to eat the PCs next. Then, one escaped villager begs strangers on the road for help... And gives them the chance to shine as true heroes striking down raiders of pure evil.

The Raven's Call is an adventure for 3rd level characters that brings mythic power and a true rescue story for 5th Edition, and introduces locales and NPCs that players will never forget. It offers new monsters and new magic in the unique style of Wolfgang Baur, one of the leading RPG adventure designers.

A truly heroic adventure that players will never forget. This is a classic-style 5th Edition adventure for 3rd level PCs near any wooded shore.

Includes 6 pregenerated characters for immediate play or for use as NPCs.

182288.name: Atlantean Merchant Barge
182288.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, two level, full color floorplan of an Atlantean Merchant Barge.

It comes with Square, Hex and No Ovelays and includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“Pirates have grappled the ship! Where is that damn Captain Tavios? He is supposed to be our escort!”—Atlantean Merchant Barge Captain

Atlantean Merchant Barge contains a two level map of an upper and lower deck of a fantasy merchant barge. The upper level is lightly armed with one harpoon and two catapults. The main feature of the Atlantean Merchant Barge is a very large cargo hold with a dual crane allowing for a quick unloading and loading of cargo. Usually one crane is unloading as goods going out are pushed toward that side of the cargo hold while the other crane loads goods coming in to the ship as space is cleared on the opposite side.

Atlantean Merchant Barge is intended for use in fantasy or pseudohistorical settings which would include Atlantis. This fantasy merchant barge is perfect for many fantasy settings where technology has not yet advanced to blackpowder cannons. Some of the Atlantean tech on the ship might also be interesting in clockwork or steampunk fantasy settings (for example the harpoon and crane might be based on these kinds of fantasy tech).

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Ocean Patrol Part Two: Captain Tavios is attempting to escort an Atlantean Merchant Barge to the mainland and back on one of his patrols. However, pirates appear from the mist, a technique he has mastered but didn’t expect the lesser cultures to be able to perform the maneuver. The pirates hook onto the Atlantean Merchant Barge he is attempting to protect. He can’t fire on the pirate ship, because it might hit the barge. So he decides to hook his warship to the other side of the barge.

Captain Tavios’ men surge onto the ship to protect the barge from the pirates making it a three way battle with the soldiers fighting the pirates and the merchant sailors trapped in the middle of the combat.

The player characters could be a part of any of the three groups; pirates, Atlantean soldiers, or even Atlantean bodyguards of the merchant on the barge. Can they turn the tide of battle in the favor of their side and either steal or protect the Atlantean goods on board?

182289.name: Ruins Of Atlanta
182289.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruins of Atlanta adds setting information to the Kalos universe, focusing in detail on the people who have chosen to live in the aftermath of the Fall of Paragon, when that hero single-handedly destroyed the city of Atlanta.

The ruins of Atlanta offer an unusual opportunity to combine superhero roleplay with the post-apocalypse genre. Many of the tropes of the post-apocalypse genre are present here: lawless gangs of scavengers, young idealists trying to build a better world, jaded cynics who will do anything to survive, power-hungry warlords, religious fanatics, high-tech enclaves, and even the occasional mutant.

Welcome to the ruins.

182290.name: Central Europe
182290.description:
From publisher blurb:

Atlas of Earth-Prime: Central Europe includes an overview of European organizations that exist in the world of Earth-Prime, with special attention paid to SHADOW, SWORD, OVERTHROW, and MENACE. It introduces the larcenous Countess Carat, provides a history of Germany’s association with super-beings, gives a look at the cyborg bikers and enforcers known as the Dreckete Partie, and shows off both the heroic team known as the Bundesguard as well as the villainous Fable Gang and much more—such as Ajax, the guardian of Amsterdam and the hidden city of Ondersdam. 11 full pages of ideas and inspiration for your M&M series!

182291.name: Pandemic
182291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pandemic is a combination of Earthly diseases and alien DNA that interacted in unpredictable ways and grew to become a new life form—a sentient life form that understood its existence would be treated as a threat. So, rather than wait for its destruction, it decided to ensure its survival and spread its diseases far and wide!

182292.name: Talontessa
182292.description:
From publisher blurb:

The cruel, beautiful and vain race of talontessa… a deadly, feminine touch to the post-apocalyptic wastes

Depending on the region, these all-female creatures are known by different names, including Junk Jezebels, Sickle-Sues, Hook Hussies, Blood Brides, Hook Girrrls and Claw Maidens.

They are the mortal enemies of skullocks, ruthless to slavers, prone to robbing travelers and always on the look out for a handsome man to either seduce or ensnare. Tribal, petty and obsessed with their looks and social status in their sisterhood, the talontessa are unpredictable and should only be approached with caution. Yet, regardless of their odd ways, passions, use of poison, traps and moody natures, they can make for great allies and are as likely to help excavators as hinder them. Unlike any other Creature of the Apocalypse in this line, loners of this race can also be utilized as player characters and this PDF comes with rules for generating such lithe, multi-limbed adventurers.

This is the 13th, and temporarily the final, free creature of the apocalypse. This special addition is 11 pages long and includes a d20 mutation list, disposition towards travelers table, d100 loot table, as well as rules for creating player character talontessa and a player handout art only sheet. We have more COTA creatures in the works but they will be part of a ‘for purchase’ sourcebook which includes all the previous beasts plus 6 never before seen mutant freaks. Stay tuned for that!

Although crafted for The Mutant Epoch role-playing game, using the Outland System Game Mechanic, a GM can easily modify the stats for the talontessa and use these feisty, velociraptor clawed hunters with another post-apocalyptic game system.

182293.name: Winter Wilderness Ruins
182293.description:
From publisher blurb:

Between the shining cities of the coast; between the villages and castles of the land; between the mines of the dwarves and the lairs of the trolls - there is Wilderness.

Every party of adventurers travels through wilderness at some point. The Winter Wilderness Ruins geomorphic set from Heroic Maps contains 12 10x10 battlemaps that can be arranged in thousands of combinations to make unique and exciting frozen wilderness maps.
Winter Wilderness Ruins is a printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Winter Wilderness Ruins is a geomorphic set, comprising 12 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. The set features large stone ruins amid an icy landscape, with statues, tombs and arcane symbols waiting to be discovered. Winter Wilderness Ruins is ideal for RPG games, and also for skirmish games like Warhammer and Frostgrave.

The set combines with other maps from the Winter Wilderness range - Winter Wilderness, Winter Forest and Winter Wilderness Locations

182294.description: Jane Austens Hochzeitsball: Traumpaare is a Schmiedespiele-exclusive expansion for Jane Austen's Matchmaker, in which you have to match the exact couples from the books.
182294.name: Jane Austens Hochzeitsball: Traumpaare

182295.description:
Set in the near future, Earth 667C gives 2 to 6 players the opportunity to save humanity from our sun going supernova. In twenty solar cycles, the sun will explode and destroy everything in our solar system. Use the remaining resources of our planet to construct your ship in orbit. Build it fast. Build it strong. Build it to save as many humans as you can and launch your spaceship to the nearest exoplanet before the supernova.

Constructing your ship is only half the game. For those that survive the solar event and launch their ships, they must face new challenges on the way to our new exoplanet home, Earth 667C. The Journey to the new planet has boosts and perils along the way, including black holes, quasars, enemy vessels, and asteroid fields. Your ship building skills and the luck of the dice combine to determine your crew and survivors' fates. Will you be the first to Earth 667C?

Earth 667C is a card and turn-based tabletop game for 2-6 players or teams. Perfect for ages 10 and up, the game is fun, encourages strategic thinking, and includes just enough chance and player relationship dynamics to create three game phases with unique challenges.

Phase 1: Ship Building
Purchase Ship Components from Space Dock, and construct the fastest ship carrying the most people. Customize your ship by doubling your navigation for better travel. Double your engineering department for increased speed. Or, add more food and life support to increase your capacity to carry survivors. Pick your strategy for your ship and start building. Optional Ship Components are available for purchase. Components like weapon systems, shuttle bays, and radiation shield provide bonuses or protection during The Journey.

Phase 2: Launch Your Ship
When the Solar Cycle hits 8, you can launch your fully constructed spaceship. Roll the dice and aim for 12 or higher to push your ship into position for The Journey. Get 12 or lower? Then you must wait, and hope that the solar clock does not tick down any further. You must launch your ship before the clock hits zero, and the sun goes supernova.

Phase 3: The Journey
When the clock hits zero and sun engulfs the Earth, the real Journey begins. Play a single turn journey, or an eight turn journey. Roll the dice and discover what boosts and perils await you while traveling to humanity's new exoplanet home. Encounter new enemies that attack and slow your ship, or pass a strong hydrogen cloud that boosts your engines. Utilize your optional Ship Components to ward off enemies or discover wormholes to increase your speed. This phase will put your ship building skills to the test. The events during The Journey can slow the fastest ship, and propel others to victory.

Be the first ship with the most survivors to reach Earth 667C and ensure the survival of the human race on our new exoplanet home!
182295.name: Earth 667C

182296.name: Into the Darkness: Map 0
182296.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Darkness: Map 0 is a (free) map-pack that features a small cave map which should be suitable for inclusion in most fantasy settings.

This product contains:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the cave.
A miniatures scaled battlemap of the cave (split over 2 pages).




(Into the Darkness: Map 0 is a (free) map-pack that features a small cave map which should be suitable for inclusion in most fantasy settings.

This product contains:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the cave.
A miniatures scaled battlemap of the cave (split over 2 pages).
An unlabelled jpg image (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square) - suitable for use with VTTs.An unlabelled jpg image (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square) - suitable for use with VTTs.

182297.name: Once Upon A Time In Arabia
182297.description:
From publisher blurb:

Put yourself at the heart of the story…

Your life is in danger from a powerful enemy. Jafar, advisor to the Caliph, is plotting a coup that will put him on the throne of Baghdad. You are the only one who knows his secret. Only you can warn the Caliph. But who will listen to a penniless adventurer? Even to venture out of hiding would be to risk death from the assassins who are scouring the city night and day to find you.

There is one hope. Fame and fortune would give you the means to expose Jafar’s treachery. Striking out from the city, your travels take you to the furthest corners of the world. You will encounter ghoul-haunted oases, magical palaces, lost cities of gold, and uncharted isles full of mystery and danger. Threatened by bandits, fire wizards, thieves and fearsome creatures, you must risk all in your determined quest to save the kingdom.


NB: Once Upon A Time In Arabia was originally published as TWIST OF FATE in the Virtual Reality series. This edition is revised and expanded with a completely new prologue.

182298.description:
Dominomega is a game for exactly 3 players for the nestorgames' double-seven binary-coding dominoes set. It is the result of applying OMEGA scoring to this dominoes set.

Each player has an allocated symbol (pip, small circle or large circle). Before the game starts, shuffle all tiles face down. Each player draws one tile (don't show it to the other players).

Starting with the 'pip' player, players take turns (pip - small circle - large circle) placing their tile on the table and orthogonally adjacent to a previously placed tile if any, so that the tiles fit into an imaginary orthogonal grid, then drawing a new playing tile from the supply (if possible).

Once all the 36 tiles have been placed, players calculate their score:

To calculate your score, multiply the sizes of all groups of squares (half tiles) containing your symbol. Notice that some half tiles contain several symbols (example: the number 7 contains all three). Notice also that each symbol is present exactly 36 times.

The player with the highest score wins. The maximum possible score is 531441.

Variant for 2 players: The small circle is not used.
182298.name: Dominomega

182299.name: Tundra: The Board Game
182299.description:
Chainsaw wielding bears, gun toting dogs and monster fish await you as you race across Alaska to be the first to spell 'Tundra'. Based on the award winning comic strip 'Tundra' by Chad Carpenter, you and your opponents will fall into fits of laughter with over 100 jokes that allow you to reek [sic] havoc on others or reap the benefits for yourself. This is the only Alaskan board game you will ever need to own!

The goal of Tundra is to be the first person to trek across the State of Alaska and collect enough letters to spell T-U-N-D-R-A These are obtained by; T - Ride a dog sled in Nome, U - Build an igloo in Barrow, N - Ice fish on the Yukon River, D - Hike the Chilkoot Trail, R - Commercial fish out of Dutch Harbor, A - Hunt on Kodiak Island.

182300.name: Operation Iron Fist
182300.description:
Operation Iron Fist is the introductory scenario of Board Wargame Magazine #11 Iron Guards: Battle of Shanghai. It is a P&P game with 4 page rule, 1 A4 map, and 26 counters.

Players play the commander of National Revolutionary Army (NRA) 9th Army Group and Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) Shanghai Special Naval Landing Forces respectively. Every hex is 3-4km across and every turn is 7-8 days. Every units represents battalion to division. Players roll a dice to get operation points to activate ground units to fight each other. Player occupied the IJN HQ wins the game after 3 turns.

182301.name: RPG Magazine (Issue 6 - Nov 2009)
182301.description:
RPG Magazine
Edição 6 - Novembro 2009

The Legend of Zelda

182302.description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: U.S.S. Montgolfier Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 23 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Montgolfier is a Saber class ship.

boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

182303.description:

The Amar is a K'tinga class ship.

boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

182304.description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.R.W. Jazkal Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 23 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Jazkal is a 22nd century Romulan bird-of-prey class ship.
182304.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Jazkal Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

182305.name: RPG Magazine (Issue 7 - Dec 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Concurso Pelo Sangue e Pela Fé

Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.K.S. Klothos Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 24 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Klothos is a D7 class ship.

182307.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Devoras Expansion Pack (cancelled)
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
182307.description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.R.W. Devoras Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 24 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Devoras is a D'deridex class ship.

182308.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Assimilated Vessel 77139 Expansion Pack (cancelled)
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
182308.description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: Assimilated Vessel 77139 Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 24 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Assimilated Vessel 77139 is an Aerie class ship.

182312.name: RPG Magazine (Issue 11 - Sep 2010)
182312.description:
RPG Magazine
Edição 11 - Setembro 2010

O Novo Mundo das Trevas

182314.description:
Set up you own sub-particle laboratory! Experiment with the most fundamental particles! Make sure you are one step ahead the other scientists! Publish your research to secure your findings! Perishing is not an option if you aim to write your name alongside the best scientists in history!

Publish or Perish is a deduction game for young scientists in which you want to find out the secret properties of each particle, collect the data, and accumulate your knowledge. But be sure to publish it before any of the other competitors do, or you might just miss the chance of winning.

Thanks to the app (and your mobile device) all secrets stay secret, and handling crucial information is both easy and intuitive. Not to mention the holograms in your hands! The augmented reality enhanced app allows you to see and enjoy experiments to the fullest!

Note: We worked hard to make sure that the science behind the game is accurate. We cooperated with scientists and consulted on all of the content.
182314.name: Publish or Perish

182315.name: Ruined Lighthouse
182315.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 265th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the remnants of a ruined lighthouse built on a small, rocky island.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

182316.name: Le Maraudeur (Issue 1 - Nov 2010)
182316.description:
Le Maraudeur - e-zine de jeu de rôle
No 1 - Novembre 2010

182317.name: Clicker Game Example
182317.description:
User Summary

Clicker Game Example is a Unity clicker game available for purchase by developers.

Le Maraudeur - e-zine de jeu de rôle
No 2 - Février 2011

rpgissuearticle: Une culotte d'enfer: une aide de jeu pour Campus
182319.description:
Le Maraudeur - e-zine de jeu de rôle
No 3 - Mai 2011

182320.description:
Recall of Cthulhu presents the horrors of the mythos in a way they were meant to be, cute and cuddly! This classic matching game can be played by the most deranged patient in the Sanatorium, as well as young cultists aged 4 and up!

Included in the game are 60 tiles representing 15 creatures, items and places of the Cthulhu Mythos, as well as a player aid for playing the advanced game.

The game can be played as a simple matching game, or the advanced game can be played which adds a layer of complexity to the game. In the advanced game, tiles have varying point values, as well as effects on the game itself. The advanced game is suitable for young cultists aged 8 and up.
182320.name: Recall of Cthulhu

182321.name: The Patrons of Lankhmar
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
182321.description:
From the back of the book:

From beneath the Outer Ocean, from out of the depths of the Great Salt Marsh, and from the odd fanes of the Street of the Gods, they come: the Patrons of Lankhmar! With the information contained in this tome, a judge can introduce such formidable beings as the Sea King, Mog the Spider God, Sheelba of the Eyeless Face, and even Death himself into any DCC RPG campaign setting.

This early look at the upcoming Dungeon Crawl Classics Lankhmar line introduces a half-dozen supernatural powers and eerie entities for use in your DCC RPG or Lankhmar campaign. Each power’s entry includes details on the entity and their role in Nehwon, tables for invoking that power’s aid, corruption charts for when things go wrong, and new spellburn possibilities. Are you ready to serve the Patrons of Lankhmar?

182322.name: Le Maraudeur (Issue 4 - Sep 2011)
rpgissuearticle: le monastère de tuath, les Ombres d’Esteren
Les sciences et l’infinie, Métal Adventures

Le Maraudeur - e-zine de jeu de rôle

Mississippi, tales of the spooky south

Le Maraudeur - e-zine de jeu de rôle
No 5 - Janvier 2012

182324.name: The Political Machine
182324.description:
"The Political Machine is a government simulation game from Stardock and the first game in the Political Machine series, in which the player leads a campaign to elect the President of the United States. The player accomplishes this goal by traveling from state to state and engaging in a variety of activities to either raise money or raise poll numbers."

Source: Wikipedia, "The Political Machine", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

182325.name: Le Maraudeur (Issue 6 - Apr 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Des liens si étroits nous unissent
Le comité pour l'exploration des mystères

Lacuna Part I. The Creation of the Mystery and the Girl from Blue City

Le Maraudeur - e-zine de jeu de rôle
No 6 - Avril 2012

182326.name: Two Thrones
182326.description:
Two Thrones is a real-time grand strategy video game developed and published by Paradox Entertainment. It is the sequel to the international version of Svea Rike III, Europa Universalis: Crown of the North.

Source: Wikipedia, "Two Thrones", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

182329.name: Big 2 Revolution
182329.description:
Description from the publisher:

Big 2 Revolution, the first release of the Revolution series from Smoothie Games, adds dynamic features to the original Big 2 shedding game. The card deck of 52 standalone poker cards features twenty cards — J, Q, K, A & 2 — that have been customized with hero abilities to enrich the original Big 2 gameplay.

182330.description: Level up in this apocalyptic world as the Walkers aim to have their revenge against the survivors. Munchkin Zombies: The Walking Dead is a 56-card expansion for Steve Jackson's Munchkin Zombies stand-alone game.
182330.name: Munchkin Zombies: The Walking Dead

182331.name: Advance Australia
182331.description:
A simple roll and move race game played on a map of Australia overlaid with a 12x12 grid f squares numbered from 1 (Brisbane) to 136 (Sydney), with 8 unnumbered squares.
The object appears to be to move from Brisbane to Sydney via the numbered squares. 9 of the squares appear to be hazards: 5 at sea (2 wrecks, 2 contrary winds), and 4 on land (3 desert and 1 bush).

An advertisement for the game was published in the "West Australian" newspaper (Perth) on Wed 6. Oct. 1909, p.6 col. 7:

"This, it seems, is an adaptation to the Commonwealth of a map game, said to have been exceedingly popular in the different countries to which it has seen made applicable. The Australian map is marked of into 136 squares, and with the aid of dice which determine each stage and counters for each of two, three, or four players, a journey is performed throughout Australia, beginning at Brisbane and terminable only at Sydney. In the shape of contrary winds, a wreck, deserts, bush, and other obstacles to easy journeyings, the way of the traveller is made difficult, and at the same time exciting, and by an ingenious contrivance in the rules the question whether he will ever reach Sydney is attended with considerable doubt, which enhances the interest of the game. Both for young and old it should prove thoroughly diverting, and it has the added advantage of possessing considerable educational value. Wigg and Son are selling it at a price intended to bring it within the reach of everyone".

182333.name: Toutilix
182333.description:
Toutilix is a card game composed of 100 cards mostly letters.

In details :
2x complete alphabets (one pink, one blue)
Some stars card
Some toutilix card
Some more vovels

There 28 different game listed in the rulebook, some are completely new and some are old game revisited.

Example of new game : Attrapix, Dagobert, empilix phrase...

In most of those new games you need to use your letters to create words or phrases expanding the ones already played. This could lead to awarding you points or to discard a card.

Revisited games: happy families, jack, barbu...

182334.name: Driller
182334.description:
Driller is a hybrid, quick, family card game. Players have to devise a strategy to score the best score with cards given. There is no pile, no drawing, you get all cards at the beginning and have to deal with them!

Driller uses a mobile device to scan the cards, visualise the drilling and control points, player turns and drill temperature. The device is placed on the game box and players place the cards beneath it, so the app can scan them.

The deck consist of 44 cards - 4 different ground types, each with 10 cards with values 1-10 and one EndDrilling card. The number on a card indicates the speed of the drill. Players can score points for speeding up the drill, using EndDrilling card or matching the card ground type with the ground, currently being drilled through. But if the players drill too fast for too long, the drill may overheat and break! Be aware that other players may want to destroy the drill on purpose to stop you from scoring!

182335.name: How, in the Name of the Trollgod, Did I Get Here?
182335.description:
From publisher blurb:

How, in the Name of the Trollgod, Did I Get Here!? is a fantasy RPG character background generator.

A freshly completed character sheet tells you a lot about a character's basic attributes, wealth (or lack of it), and equipment, but what did this paragon of innocence do before this first day of their new life of adventure, and what led them to abandon their old life? All will be revealed inside these pages!

Old Delvers Never Die...
Also included in this book is a character 're-generator' dedicated to those unfortunate or foolhardy characters no longer with us.

Dearly departed heroes and fools can now be revived for one last adventure, or maybe more, because it turns out they had a miraculous escape back when everyone thought they'd breathed their last. Now, many years later, they’ve at last rekindled their lust for adventure, so dig out those old character sheets and take your many erstwhile deceased delvers on one last hurrah!

The whole package includes:


gameplay like a mini solo adventure for each character generated
medieval/fantasy occupation tables (100+ occupations)
magical occupation table (30 occupations)
tribal and higher kindred occupation table
career experience, crisis and promotion table
life events table (36 different events and effects)
characteristics table (1000+ characteristics)
miraculous escape table (30 different escapes and effects)
ageing and ailments tables (36 different ailments and effects)
birth and family circumstances tables
fortune table
rank and rank benefits table
Sensitive Stuff at the Gaming Table, a feature by Elin Dalstal


This book has been written to fit perfectly with the Deluxe Tunnels and Trolls FRPG system by way of example, but it is essentially multi-system, requiring little or no adaptation to use with other FRPGs.

182336.name: Millionaire Manager
182336.description:
Do you think that earning money is more difficult than spending? Millionaire Manager lets you try to spend $25 million within 25 days! No way it is going to be an easy walk! Think strategically and use your common sense - only then there is a tiny chance that you will succeed!

- Enjoy the unique game experience!
- Hundreds of events and situations to waste money!
- Many unique combo's to be even more efficient with money spending!
- Compete with other players to become the best Millionaire manager!
- Gets easy? Unlock Hard and Extreme modes for real spenders!

Source: The Developer Website.

182337.name: The Reign of Terror
182337.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 4-6 characters of level 4.

Jean Lemaistre, celebrated cavalier of the Order of the Lily, defeated the vampires of Château Rougemord many winters ago, though he himself perished in the process. Having no wish to be brought back to life, in common with most cavaliers of his Order, Lemaistre was entombed near the village of Sans-Secours, close to the château, with all of his possessions either bequeathed to the Order or sent back to his family.

All, that is, except for his banner, the “Fleur de Lis”, which inexplicably failed to return, and which the Order is now paying you handsomely to retrieve for them from Lemaistre’s tomb, which is presumably where it ended up.

So wrapped up in warm winter clothing you have journeyed into the mountains in the hope that the trail that you now seek has neither gone too cold nor regained any of its former danger. After all, it has been 50 years …

Four Dollar Dungeons are standalone adventures designed to be logical, entertaining, challenging and balanced, and easily integrated into any campaign world.

Each adventure has enough material to last three or more playing sessions and enough experience to raise four characters of the appropriate level up by one extra level. Treasure is commensurate with the encounter challenges faced. Scaling information is included for adventuring parties of five or six.

Although this adventure is set around a snow-capped mountain range most of the action takes place within the cold stone walls of the Château de Rougemord.

182339.name: Necromanzia
182339.description:
In Necromanzia troviamo un'introduzione all'arte oscura della negromanzia e nuovi incantesimi, talenti, oggetti magici, e creazioni necromantiche. Ci sono anche i capitoli su come diventare un lich e suggerimenti per il gamemaster.

In Necromancy we find an introduction to the dark art of necromancy as well as new spells, feats, magic items, and necromantic creations. There are also chapters on becoming a lich and tips for the gamemaster.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
182340.description:
Description from the publisher:

A contested region of space accessible through a known wormhole has drawn the attention of powerful forces throughout the galaxy. Both the Federation and the Klingon Empire, who share a delicate alliance at this time, have recently built outposts in the region — but now news of grave troubles brewing in the region has prompted both the Klingons and the Federation to investigate immediately.

Command your ship, recruit new crew members, earn experience points, and use your skills to confront the challenges of the Star Trek universe. Explore and face a variety of challenges on a randomly built space map using the venture tile system first introduced in the award-winning game Mage Knight.

Star Trek: Frontiers is designed for 1 to 4 players with multiple competitive, cooperative and solo scenarios. Work together to defeat hostile ships or compete to explore and uncover hidden mysteries. Players need to overcome obstacles to expand their knowledge and use their leadership as they adventure in order to be victorious in their exploration!
182340.name: Star Trek: Frontiers
boardgameexpansion: Star Trek: Frontiers – Seven of Nine
Star Trek: Frontiers – The Return of Khan Expansion Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
#36: 2016, A Year in Review
4. Devon Dice podcast, review of 2015 part 2
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 16 - Looking Ahead to 2016
Table for One Bonus Episode - Dungeon Alliance with Andrew Parks
The Good The Board and The Joe Likes Space Alert Way Too Much: Episode 77 “Programming Games”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 61!! Don't Forget The Contest
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 63!!

182341.name: Karten klatschen
182341.description:
Translated from the rule book:

A lot of different pairs of cards lie scattered over the table. When revealing a card good eyes and quick hands are needed. Who keeps seeing everything and reacts fast fetches the most pairs!

The game consists of 54 cards, making 27 pairs of 2 cards each. The cards are put into a tile. Each player turns over the uppermost card on the tile and reveals it. As soon as the new card is revealed all players can put their hand on the other card of this pair, that was revealed before the current one. The player who has the most pairs when the tile is used up is the winner.

182342.description: A larger stand-up to replace the stand up in the game. Also includes a dice tower to assemble on the sheet.
182342.name: Darkest Night: Necromancer Stand-up and Dice Tower

182343.description: This promotional ability card was released for the Thief hero found in the Catacombs Third Edition base game. Note: this card will be released in a future product.
182343.name: Catacombs: Shadowlithe Fist promo

182344.name: Myric's Elemental Maze
182344.description:
From publisher blurb:

Filbar Friday’s offering is FN14 - Myric’s Elemental Maze. The conclusion of the Filbar North series this adventure puts the party in front of a large and dangerous maze and home to the power of the Elementals! Each section has a riddle that the party must solve in order to obtain a key and continue to the center of the maze where the party will face off with a very special adversary. This adventure is not for those with little experience and will require the ability to solve riddles!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a high level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

182345.name: The Deluxe Guide to Reincarnation
182345.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Modern Take on an Ancient Classic

Reincarnate is more than just a cheaper, lower-level version of raise dead that you can use even if you don’t have a 5,000 gp diamond lying around, or don’t have a 9th-level cleric in the party. Reincarnate is a chance to roll the dice on your character’s destiny, and the spell provides a real and tangible possibility of creating dramatic change for the creature brought back. Many players enjoy the high risk and high reward experience of reincarnate, and others appreciate the interesting roleplaying opportunities it provides. But the spell’s a bit outdated, and it shows. For one, there are tons of exciting humanoid races in products released after the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook that you can’t become, because they were created after the table was made. Further, there’s one little phrase that turns a reincarnate spell cast on anything besides a humanoid into a real pain:

For non-humanoid creatures, a similar table of creatures of the same type should be created.

If you’ve ever had your game come to a grinding halt because your druid wanted to cast reincarnate on his animal companion, or you wish that there was a more convenient way to include all the fun new player character races in a single place, or you wish there was a teensy-weensy chance that a reincarnate could turn you into a medusa, this is the book for you. In addition to an updated set of tables for humanoid creatures, this book contains detailed nested tables for determining the new form of an animal companion, or a familiar, or a creature of any creature type. With no less than 50 tables containing creatures from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiaries 1 – 4, plus other sources, you have everything you need to make reincarnating any creature a fun and exciting experience. Plus, the book includes a set of optional rules for karmic reincarnation, which allows a character’s actions in life to influence how they return. Never look at reincarnate the same way again!

182346.name: Tephra Kickstarter Adversary Book
182346.description:
From publisher blurb:

In January 2012, Cracked Monocle began a kickstarter to publish its steampunk roleplaying game, Tephra, which had been in playtesting for over four years. All they needed was a thousand dollars to cover some basic publishing costs and get their book set up at a print-on-demand company. Little did they know how far their kickstarter would take them. One month later, Tephra had raised almost $23,000. People from all over the world, from Brazil to Singapore to right back in Cracked Monocle’s home state of Texas, had pledged their support behind Tephra: the Steampunk RPG. One of the biggest draws was the custom, Kickstarter-exclusive Adversary Book full of crazy enemies, exotic adventures, and intriguing NPCs fit for any person’s Tephra game but pulled straight from the imagination of our Kickstarter backers.

This is that book, and we thank you for making Tephra become a reality. From the backers who just wanted a copy to the backers who submitted their own adversary - all of your contributions were necessary for this dream to come true.

182347.name: Enemies Without
182347.description:
From the publisher's website:
“There is no end to the abomination of the alien. Do not allow any guise of sentience to stay your hand – there can be no hesitation when the survival of humanity as a species is at stake.”
–Inquisitor Kartize, Ordo Xenos

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce Enemies Without, a new supplement for Dark Heresy Second Edition!

New threats gnaw incessantly at the borders of the Imperium. Despite countless righteous Wars of Purgation, the xenos threat grows in the Askellon sector. Unthinking Orks ravage countless worlds. The enigmatic Eldar slay innocents without reason or mercy. Dark Eldar take slaves to a fate worse than death, while the monstrous Tyranids devour a path wherever their Hive Fleets roam. These hideous xenos are an affront to the Emperor’s rule, and no true servant of the Imperium can rest while even one remains within the sector.

Against these terrifying aliens, these unfeeling and monstrous beings, there stands only the bright shield of the Ordo Xenos. These noble hunters of the Inquisition safeguard the worlds of the Imperium, protecting thousands of human lives from horrors as obscene and perfidious as any daemon spawned from the Warp. Now, with the Enemies Without supplement for Dark Heresy Second Edition, you and your fellow Acolytes can take your places as members of the Ordo Xenos and stand against the heresy brought by these aliens from their strange stars.

With a new role, new home worlds, new backgrounds, and an armoury full of new weapons – both Imperial and xenos in origin – your Acolytes will be well-equipped to battle the countless threats that assault the borders of the Imperium. Your quest will not be easy. For every wicked xenos creature slain in glorious battle, three more slip past your defenses into the undefended regions of the Askellon sector. Your vigilance must be constant; your justice must be merciless!

182348.name: Der kleine Verkehrsprofi
182348.description:
Der kleine Verkehrsprofi (the little traffic expert) is an educational game by Ravensburger. From the rulebooks introductory text: With luck and skill the goal of this smart and at the same time educational game is to get the most traffic sign tiles. By playing the children learn to know the most important traffic signs!

The game has a wooden playing piece (child) moving around the gameboard. There is only one pawn for all of the players. Before the game begins all tiles are put face back on the game board. The game board then is covered by tiles with the exception of the middle spot which is the pawns starting point. The tiles depict traffic signs and come in pairs, e.g. one pair consisting of a tile for green traffic light and a tile for red light. The tile back depicts both versions green and red, the tile front only one. Players move the common playing piece around by rolling a die. When the child moves to a space where a tile is they first have to guess which picture is on the tiles front side. Two possibilities are pictured on the tile back. Upon a correct guess the player whose turn it is also has to tell the meaning of this traffic sign. If both are correct the player can keep the tile and roll again. If not correct it is the next players turn. The game ends when all tiles are taken. The player with the most tiles in his/her possession wins.
The game also includes a sheet with all traffic signs in the game and what they mean.

182349.name: China-Burma-India: The Lost Theater Part I – The Japanese Invade: December 1941 - May 1942
182349.description:
Defend Burma!

Can you help defend Burma from the onslaught of the Japanese conquerors? Or, can you expand the Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere by liberating Burma from the imperial colonials? You now have the chance to try your skills on the tactical battlefield during the crucial months between December 1941 and May 1942. Squads of infantry, tanks, artillery, support, and even some airpower! The tools are at your command. Can you succeed?

This ASL compatible product from the St. Louis ASL Club contains:
- 59 Page Magazine
- 22"x28" Historical map with 3 scenarios for a campaign game or they can be played as standalone scenarios.
- 12 scenarios for the ASL geomorphic maps

182350.name: Harried in Hillsfar
182350.description:
From the front page:

In the village of Elventree, near the oppressive city of Hillsfar, a recent string of strange occurrences has the locals on edge. The factions have gathered here on the borders of the forest of Cormanthor to determine what’s happening. Is this the machinations of Hillsfar, or something more? Five one-hour mini-adventures for 1st-2nd level characters.

182351.description:
You are all thieves! Each round in Thief's Market you roll the loot dice and split them up, then use your earnings to buy devious plans, henchmen, and finery in order to become the most notorious thief of all!

When the display of available cards to purchase can't be refilled, the game ends. Players with the most henchmen and gold score bonus points, then the player with the most notoriety in cards, tokens, and bonuses wins!
182351.name: Thief's Market
boardgamepodcastepisode: #28: First Anniversary, Fantasy Board Game League, Dead of Winter on tap, State of the Podcast & Beer Histories
Episode 20: Blood Rage Review - 20 Questions
Episode 22 - Thief’s Market & Age of War
Episode 64 - Inis
HLG 6: Samen
MN 0133 Seven Games Reviewed in 30 Minutes - Quadralegthimotcovok
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 148
The Game Pit: Episode 68 - Picking Over the Bones
WashingCon – Dave Chalker and Thief’s Market
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 62!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 63!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 93!!

182352.description:
What's left of civilization on this planet is being cut into portions by those most prone to cutting. Those of us who want something better...we'll find it somewhere else.

The Exodus Fleet features resource management and tableau building mechanisms along with a highly interactive system of role selection and bidding in which players compete to hire miners, spaceship builders, and other groups to piece together their own fleet to escape a dying Earth. Just building ships and filling them with refugees will score you points, but making sure your ships work together may give you the advantage you need.

Players must decide whether to prioritize building ships within one faction (to score bonus points) or whether it might be better to build ships with synergy for powering their actions. Is it better to spend your resources on more ships or rescuing more survivors off of Earth? Should you gamble on explorers or just take a turn to gather more resources? And exactly how much money does my opponent still have? Can they outbid me for the action I really need to perform? A variety of strategic and tactical dilemmas await...
182352.name: The Exodus Fleet
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist

182353.name: Revelations
182353.description:
From publisher blurb:


Who IS Lady Wonderra?

She seems to exist in three different times, and in each of them, she offers Victory for a price. In the Fantasy Era, she is known as Lady Wonderra. In the Near-Modern Era, she is Cindy Wonderra, Miss Wonderra or "The Hookup." In the Space Era, she is Phane Wonderra. She has the best equipment that can be found, and always seems to know what an adventurer needs.

Who is she? Are there three Wonderras or, more amazingly, merely one?

We've asked these questions through twelve issues of Victory's Vault. Now, it's time for some answers. Meet the true Lady Wonderra, discover how she does what she does where and when she does, and dare to ask if she can help out YOUR Victory System Campaign!

182354.name: Sakura Boys and Girls
182354.description:
The players have to create the best couples of Sakura High School.
They start at the middle of an area made of 54 cards(27 males and 27 females).
At his turn, a player can use 0, 1 or 2 actions(similar or different) among 3:

move one of his 2 pawns towards a card or an empty space.
reveal a hidden card.
make the union of a boy and a girl with his 2 pawns on their cards.




The distance between the boy and the girl and the quality of the couple can be rewarded by any white tokens(each turn, one can be used to play 2 more actions).
Each union and each white token worth 1 victory point.
The winner is the player who has the higher number of victory points or white tokens if there is a tie.

182355.name: Club Zen
boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 020 – I, Geek Interviews T.C. Petty, III
Perfect Information Episode 11 – Petty Little Special
182355.description:
East meets West in Club Zen, a relaxing worker placement game where the goal is to plan out your seven-day working vacation in the most Zen way possible. Manage your work and emotional stress, make new friends, attend exciting events such as hang gliding or rock climbing, collect stones for your personal Zen Garden, or take a nap! How will you spend your time at the 5-star Caribbean resort, Club Zen? The most relaxed or "zen" player at the end of their one week stay will be the winner.

Unlike traditional resource management and worker placement games, Club Zen encourages players to visit the same locations together, many times for an increased benefit for all players involved. Because of this, the game features a measure of cooperation and meaningful positive interaction, while still having only one winner. The game is a sandbox of strongly thematic and relaxing environments to explore, with each element tuned to both be strategic and evoke a real sense of immersion.

182356.name: We're Going on a Bear Hunt Board Game
182356.description:
Roll and move game, with an end game chase between the leading player and the bear.

From the publisher:

A bright and colourful race and chase board game featuring the beautiful illustrations from the best selling book. The aim of the game is to be the first player to reach home, without being caught by the bear! Youngest player goes first and rolls one dice and move that number of spaces in the direction of the arrows on the board. If a player lands on a 'Uh-uh' space they must take a card from the top of the card pile. If the card is red 'We can't go over it' this ends their turn. If the card is green 'Oh no! We've got to go through it' they can roll the dice again and move forward.
When a player reaches the 'Run' space they must stop and take full control of the game. Throw both dice and move your character that number of spaces, then throw just one dice and move the bear that number of spaces chasing after you. Keep going like this, it's a race to try and get home before the bear catches you. If you reach the 'Home' space before the bear catches up with you, you win!

This game has strong educational components and helps children learn through social interaction as well as taking turns, all whilst having great fun. The game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for children ages 3 years and up.

182358.name: Hexenreigen
182358.description:
Publisher blurb

Ein kleiner Hexenzirkel leidet unter den Machenschaften und der Machtgier seines boshaften Anführers. Es gelang dem Hexenmeister, obwohl er ein Mann ist, die Führung über die anderen Hexen zu übernehmen und alle Versuche, ihn loszuwerden sind gescheitert.

Eine der Hexen will sich aber damit nicht abfinden. Sie möchte ihre Freiheit zurück und sucht verzweifelt nach einer Möglichkeit, wie sie ihren Anführer austricksen kann. Doch leider hat der Hexenmeister sie und die übrigen Hexen in der Hand, da es ihm gelungen ist, seine magischen Kräfte zu verstärken und sie jederzeit verfluchen kann.

Es braucht also tapfere Helden, die bereit sind zu helfen und dem Hexenzirkel beistehen. Und welcher Held würde eine solche Bitte schon ausschlagen?

Doch können die Helden den Hexenmeister rechtzeitig aufhalten, bevor er von den Plänen erfährt, die zu seinem Sturz führen sollen? Und was ist der Grund für seine enorme magische Macht? Steckt vielleicht mehr dahinter, als die Hexen und die Helden zunächst ahnen?


An evil warlock used cunning and treachery to take control of a small coven of witches and now holds their fate in his hands. Every attempt to overthrow him has failed, but one witch refuses to submit. In the name of freedom, she searches far and wide for help.

A party of valiant heroes answers the call, but can they save her coven before the warlock learns about their plans and seeks revenge? How did he become so powerful? Is there more going on here than anyone suspects? Find out, in Witch’s Dance…

Suggested for 1 GM and 3 to 5 players, ages 14 years and up.

182359.name: Aventurischer Bote (Sonderausgabe Ratcon 2015)
182359.description:
User description

Special edition of Aventurischer Bote for the RatCon 2015 convention.

182360.name: Act Out
182360.description:
Do you have...
A quick wit?
A creative mind?
A sense of humor?
A little acting talent?
At least three friends?

Then you're ready to take on the challenge of Act Out! You and your team will take on opposing teams in a hilarious, quick thinking game where your team improvises skits based
on the cards you are given by your opponents!

When you play Act Out!, every game is different! Act Out! includes methods for both novice and advanced play, and is great for
drama education, team building, or a fun night with friends!

182362.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Warship
182362.description:
From the publisher's website:

Batten the hatches!

Whether your party’s sailing into a stormy naval battle or sneaking onto a pirate ship in search of swashbuckler booty, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every captain’s cabin and coil of rope. Fortunately, with Paizo’s latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don’t have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. Full of beautiful details ranging from mounted crossbows to wooden deck inlays, this double-sided map makes the perfect setting for any foray into the ocean’s battlefields!

Don’t waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Warship, you’ll be prepared next time your party’s ready to engage in nautical warfare!

182363.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Giant Lairs
182363.description:
From the publisher's website:

Super-Sized Peril!

Whether your party’s sneaking into a massive creature’s lair to steal a legendary treasure or mounting an assault on a giant tribe’s fortress, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every oversized bed and ominously large stewpot. Fortunately, with Paizo’s latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don’t have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. From an ancient, abandoned giant manor to a titan’s war council, this double-sided map makes the perfect setting for any foray into the realms of giants! Don’t waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Giant Lairs, you’ll be prepared next time your party’s ready to challenge giant foes!

On tabletops across the world, the Flip-Mat Revolution is changing the way players run their fantasy roleplaying games! Why take the time to sketch out ugly scenery on a smudgy plastic mat when dynamic encounters and easy clean-up is just a Flip away?

182364.name: Disney Princess Memo-Menu
182364.description:
Set the table with Snow White's help.
Snow White is moved round a table (free direction)with places for each of the 7 dwarves and herself. This move is driven by a die. Each place counts one point.
For each place there is an individual set of under plate, silver plate and chicken dish. Which have to be placed in this series while the game.
The actual player tries to find the right part from beside the plan. If the player has found the right part he is allowed to continue with the next part for the same place.
If not, the next player roles the die and continues.
If all 3 parts are found the actual player gets a diamond.
If all places have all parts the game ends and the player with the highest number of diamonds wins.

182365.name: Axion
182365.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Axion features character development and a storyline in both single and multiplayer.

182366.name: Horoskop: Ein astrologisches Spiel
182366.description:
This game is about astrology. The central game board shows an astrological solar system. The board is 12 sectors for the 12 star signs. There are 7 concentric rings (wire rings in their hollows), one for each celestial body. The rings are Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn. Each ring has a colored bead for the celestial body itself and red (favorable effect) and black (unfavorable effects).

Each player has an individual board with 2 concentric circles. They show also the 12 star sign sectors, written at the edge of the big circle. In the inner circle the sectors are numbered with 1 to 12. This numbers are called houses, which represent astrological aspects like personality, "possession and wealth", "adventure, erotic".
The inner circle has 5 concentric rings where special marker placed at the beginning on each field of the middle ring one.

At the begin of the game the inner circle is positioned by random (special dice rolling) and stays then till the end of the game.
Also the position of the rings on the central board are random turned at the beginning as described in the rules.

The player chooses a house (number) with as much red and colored beads in the equivalent sector.

Dependent on the number each player has another star sector.
Each round the sun ring is rotated by 1 (Counter clock) and for the other circles 2 dice are rolled. 1 dice shows which circle is rotated and the second die shows how much.

How many dice rolls are possible for the actual player is calculated out of the sum of red plus colored pearls minus black pearls in his star sign sector.

The player is allowed to roll the dice less than allowed.
The players look at the Pearl of the actual moved circle in the sector relevant for them. If the pearl is red or colored he moves the marker on his board 1 ring to the edge otherwise (black) 1 ring to the center.

Game Ends after a preset sun moves (e.g. 1,5 rounds). The player who has most of his marks on the outer ring wins the game.
The rules allow to read the astrological result for each player.

182367.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – The Light Shineth
182367.description:
Description from the publisher:

Doomtown: Reloaded – The Light Shineth is a Pinebox expansion that can be added to your Doomtown: Reloaded base set to inject new mechanisms and new strategies into your decks! So get ready partner, are you ready for your showdown at high noon?

182368.name: Mammoth Gravity Battles
182368.description:
Mammoth gravity battles is a game of skill and turn-based strategy with gravity, planets, physics, black holes, missiles, mammoth explosions, crazy weapons and best of all, woolly mammoths (in flying saucers). Out now on Windows Phone and Windows 8 Store. Coming soon to PC, Mac, Linux, Android, iPhone, iPad.

Mammoth Gravity Battles has a strong single player campaign, with varied missions and a range of opponents to defeat. Missions include targeting specific asteroids/planets, destroying a well defended base, defending a convoy and defeating the deadly missile cruisers. Multiplayer is all about battles. Battle friends in a simpler 2D layout or more demanding 3D layout, you can completely customise the game to your liking, setting everything from number of planets or strength of gravity, to the types of weapons available.

•Over 60 single player Campaign levels
•Four player multi-player pass and play battles
•Try battles in both simpler 2D and mind boggling 3D levels
•16 different weapons; rockets, cannon, frag grenades, minigun, shotgun...
•Collectable weapon system - turn the tables mid game
•Varied levels create different challenges each time you play
•Tactical gameplay, moving ships and planets
•Destructible planets, fragment into asteroids that in turn can be destroyed

Source: The Game Website.

182369.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Inquisitor's TIE Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set
182369.description:
Description from the publisher:

Personally tasked by Darth Vader to eliminate any surviving Jedi Knights, the Inquisitor had access to the Empire’s most advanced technologies, including the TIE Advanced prototype, a groundbreaking improvement over the TIE fighter designs of its time.

Thanks to Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Inquisitor's TIE Expansion Pack, this lethal starfighter appears as a carefully detailed and pre-painted miniature at 1/270 scale, along with four ship cards, including one for the Inquisitor himself. Additionally, the Inquisitor's TIE Expansion Pack contains five upgrades, a maneuver dial, and all the tokens you need to launch into space and pursue your foes through the stars!

182370.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Ghost Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set
182370.description:
Description from the publisher:

Spark your own rebellion against the Galactic Empire with the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Ghost Expansion Pack!

Fly into battle with the Ghost and Phantom, and recruit the talents of Ezra Bridger, Kanan Jarrus, Hera Syndulla, and the other heroes of Star Wars Rebels. The galaxy's most famous VCX-100 – and likely the hardest to detect – the Ghost enters the game as a massive, pre-painted, large-base Rebel starship that comes with rules for deploying the accompanying attack shuttle miniature into battle. You'll also find eight ship cards, sixteen upgrades, and all requisite tokens and maneuver dials.

182371.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Imperial Assault Carrier Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set
182371.description:
Description from the publisher:

Pursue the Rebellion's subversive agents across the galaxy with the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Imperial Assault Carrier Expansion Pack!

Designed for use within the game's Cinematic Play and Epic Play formats, the pre-painted Gozanti-class cruiser miniature comes accompanied by two TIE fighter escorts, eleven ship cards, and twenty-six upgrades. Additionally, the expansion includes a set of four new missions for Cinematic Play that follow a Gozanti charged with intercepting and destroying agents of the Rebel Alliance.

182372.name: Wissens-Quiz für Kinder
182372.description: Quiz game for children from 6 to 10 years. The Players try to answer questions in each of the 8 categories. The catagory is choosen by a simplified Trivial Pursuit game board.

182373.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Punishing One
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set
182373.description:
Description from the publisher:

Despite his slovenly appearance, Dengar earned a reputation as one of the galaxy's most effective mercenaries, and his signature JumpMaster 5000, the Punishing One, was also much more than the lightly-armed, crescent-shaped scout ship it appeared to be.

With its pre-painted, large-base JumpMaster 5000 miniature and its array of ship and upgrade cards, the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Punishing One brings both Dengar and his surprisingly powerful ship into play, along with a maneuver dial, all requisite tokens, and the ability to fire its turret in a 360-degree arc.

182374.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Mist Hunter
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set
182374.description:
Description from the publisher:

The signature vessel of the bounty hunters Zuckuss and 4-LOM, the Mist Hunter from the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Mist Hunter is a pre-painted, small-base miniature G-1A starfighter with three attack, one agility, four hull, and four shields.

Meanwhile, the expansion's nine upgrades reflect the Scum and Villainy faction’s willingness to gain advantages with modifications of questionable legality. You'll find an illicit cloaking device and a tractor beam among the upgrades, along with four ship cards, a maneuver dial, and all requisite tokens.

182375.description:
Description from the publisher:

Passions flare and Jinteki faces a game-changing crisis in Android: Netrunner – Business First, the second Data Pack in the "Mumbad Cycle".

As the issue of clone rights rises to prominence during the Indian Union's national elections, Business First explores the tensions and conflicts within this tumultuous environment with sixty new cards (a complete playset of nineteen different cards) that leak horror stories about Jinteki's treatment of its clones, find the Corp's PR team scrambling to draw attention to its work with sustainable foods, and follow Haas-Bioroid's efforts to capitalize upon its rival's missteps.
182375.name: Android: Netrunner – Business First
boardgamepodcastepisode: Breaking News — Episode 45

182376.description:
Kribbel-Krabbel, the crazy tile laying game.

Description from the back of the game box:
Each Kribbel-Krabbel ant consists of 3 parts: head, belly and rear end. Each part has another colour. Sometimes the head is red, the belly yellow and the rear end green, sometimes the head is green, the belly red and the rear end yellow. But all ants have something in common: a stenciled out hole. either at the head, the belly or the rear end. The game is quickly understood: each ant must be laid on top of another ant, and in a way that through the hole the same colour is visible. For example: an ant has a red head, yellow belly and blue rear end. The hole is in the head section. You can put this ant on top of two kinds of other ants: either one with a red head heading in the same direction as the ant You are laying - or You change the direction of Your ant and lay it on top of an ant with a red rear section.
Who is the first to lay all his ant cards?
182376.name: Kribbel-Krabbel

182377.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – What Lurks Below
182377.description:
Description from the publisher:

The space hulk Kaerux Erameas has landed on Sacaellum, and a host of Tyranids have caught the scent of blood.

Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – What Lurks Below is the fourth pack in the Planetfall cycle, and here you'll find cards that give new significance to planet symbols and invite you to fight for your faction's goals. This War Pack also offers a new Tyranids Genestealer warlord and his eight- card signature squad as well as fifty-one other cards to swell your armies. In What Lurks Below, every faction gains new ways to wage war and new reasons to fight.

182378.name: Geschichten aus dem Bärenland
182378.description: Each Player gets a bear as figure. The game is a version of Snakes and Ladders. Additional there are fields on the board,when reaching them you can roll a second time, have to go backwards or to pause.

182379.name: 8BitMMO
videogamehonor: 2013 Indie Prize Best in Show: Director's Choice Winner
182379.description:
8BitMMO is a retro-style 2D massively multiplayer game! It's a giant construction sandbox -- you can build a home or a castle in a persistent streaming world. Found and manage your own city. Fight evil Lawyercats and engage in player vs player battle.

Awards
Tokyo Game Show: Sense of Wonder Night - Winner Best Technological Game
2013 Seattle Independent Game Competition - Winner
Indie Prize Showcase, San Francisco - Director's Choice

Source: The Publisher Website.

182380.name: Robogem
182380.description:
A programming game, designed to teach kids (6+) to program. Players try to collect gems by programming a robot on the board.

The robot takes three commands: move forward, turn left and turn right. Players string these commands to guide the robots. Advanced games include functions that can contain many moves which can then be repeated when wanted.

First player to collect three gems and return them to their home base wins the game.

182381.name: Piat Gin
182381.description:
Piat Gin is a card drafting game with Rummy-like scoring at the end. Players are dealt 6 cards. They keep one, placing face-down in front of them, and then pass two from their hand face-up to the player on their left. This is repeated, keeping one passing two, until they only have three cards left in their hand. During this last hand (you'll have three cards) you'll keep one and only pass one. Once finished players will keep both of these cards to finish their set of cards. All players reveal their hands and begin scoring. The highest scoring hand wins and receives bonus points. Play to a set score, usually 100 points.

Piat Gin is the next game in the series of "alien card games", Konog being the first. Games designed around the premise of a fictional alien race and how they might go about making a game that reflects their culture, biology, ideologies and other aspects of the species. These games are imported and introduced to those of us living in the Core Systems by the explorers and pioneers returning from the frontiers.

The Camenni are a long-lived species, known for extreme patience and sudden bursts of well-coordinated action. Piat Gin is a simple past time, different from the more complex time-consuming games that the elders might take part in (games similar to Chess or Go in which single turns can take years or decades to accomplish). This is not a game that possesses lavish details or ornate components. Piat Gin is carried by Camenni adventurers due to its small size or used to teach children patience and to practice the observation of subtle interactions of others.

The card faces and their features are intentionally kept simple, possessing no complex Camenni script, only differing amounts of circles, triangles, or rhombus (3 suits, numbered 1-6). This is so the game can be taught to most any species that might be encountered (please note that this deck is not resistant to mucus, salivation, persperation, or extremely high body temperatures like standard "outrider" decks). Camenni will drag a game of Piat Gin on for hours and even days when playing with each other. Of course, we don't have that luxury and play a round in a few minutes.

182382.name: Die Hochzeits Prinzessin
182382.description: Each Player gets a bride as a figure. On the board there are 4 areas which represent shops. You have to circle each of them to get a necessary item: a pair of shoes, a wedding dress, a bouquet and a diamond ring. There are also two kinds of spezial fields on the board: some where you can steal an item from an other player and some where you can jump to an other area. The first who gets all 4 items is the winner.

182383.name: IWO TABLE-WAR
182383.description:
War game on a European map.
Each player has a bunch of military figures (tanks, Artillery, Ships, ...)
The map is separated in different countries with each a number of cities.
The whole map shows lines which cross each other, each point (possible position for a figure) has 6 neighbors.
At the beginning the players choose countries and place one of their figures on each of its cities.
If the player has not enough figures to place one on each city he has to choose another country.
Each type of figure has it's own "length of move", "shot range" and "Value of points".
On players turn he can move each of his figures it's "length of move" and shoot on one of the opponents figures. Roll a die (5 and 6 hit). The opponent is allowed to shoot also with all of his figures which are in range, also with the hit one.
After this all hit figures are removed.
Then the Opponent has his turn with move and shoot and the first player may shoot back.
After each double turn it is checked if a player has conquered a capital City. If this is the case all opponent figures are removed from this country.
After 8 double turns there is a value of points calculated from the number of his cities. With this points new stones can be bought dependent on the "Value of points" of the different types. These can be placed on own cities.
The same calculation is done at the end of the game. The winner is the player with the higher number.
The game ends after a predefined number of rounds or if one player has lost all his figures.

182384.name: Katz & Maus
182384.description:
The players have to save the coloured mice from the cat.
The mice are placed randomly on the board. After time to memorize theirs positions the mice are covered by hats. At the border of the board there are coloured holes. The players have to move the hats with the mice under it to the hole with the same color as the mouse has. If the color fits the player gets one point, if not the cat captures this mouse.
The game ends when there is at most one, captured mouse. The player with most points is the winner.

182385.description:
"Non enim ignavia magna imperia contineri (Great empires are not maintained by timidity)."
― Tacitus

In the late Roman Republic, four noble families try to assume power over the strongest nation in the old world. Players gain popularity by affecting the four influential areas of everyday Roman:


Expand the Roman sovereignty through military campaigns
Exploit riches and supply the Forum’s Markets
Exhibit your power by offering the best shows in the Games
Extend your political influence by giving away exclusive privileges to the decadent senators of the republic.


Rome: Rise to Power lasts five rounds of play, with each round being divided into four phases:


Roll Power Dice and determine turn order
Placement of Power Dice
Resolution of Power Dice
Scoring and clean up


After five rounds, players tally their points and the player with the most points wins the game and is declared the first of the Imperator.

Rise to Power ™ System
At GEG, we have designed an innovative dice placement system that enhances player decisions while reducing the luck factor.
